Description: Sherd preserving full profile of black-glaze pottery echinus bowl with incurving rim and high, straight-walled ring foot; interior glazed; exterior and underside reserved except for glazed black band around rim with two large drips.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
(July 2014) See Rotroff, Agora XXIX nos. 983-985 fig. 62, pl. 75 (310 BC - 300 BC).
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 47, no. D13, pl. 21. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.054)
